title: Mount Rushmore National Memorial: Timeline
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     Timeline                Timeline       1923  A sculpture in the Black Hills is suggested by South Dakota State Historian Doane Robinson (Dec 28, 1923).  1925  Federal Government and South Dakota authorize a carving in the Harney National Forest (March 3 &5). Dedication of Mount Rushmore as a national memorial with a flag ceremony (October 1).  1927  First ceremonial drilling takes place at Mount Rushmore after President Coolidge hands Borglum a set of drill bits (August 10).   First actual carving begins on Mount Rushmore (October 4).  1930  Dedication of the Washington figure (July 4).  1936  Dedication of the Jefferson figure, attended by President Franklin D. Roosevelt (August 30).  1937  Dedication of the Lincoln figure (September 17).  1939  Dedication of the Roosevelt figure (July 2).  1941  Gutzon Borglum dies in Chicago (March 6). Final drilling takes place under the direction of Lincoln Borglum (October 31).
